feedback.Physical Object: Included — A bounded, rigid container with a defined physical form.
feedback.Synthetic: Included — Manufactured from silica and additives through industrial processes.
feedback.Biological/Biomimetic: Excluded — Has no biological origin or design inspiration.
feedback.Powered: Excluded — Inert and not dependent on energy input.
feedback.Structural: Included — Provides rigid containment and mechanical resistance.
feedback.Physical Medium: Included — Composed of solid material (glass), with mass and volume.
feedback.Active: Excluded — Passive and unresponsive to environment or input.
feedback.Intentionally Designed: Included — Specifically formed to hold liquids, interface with closures, and enable pouring.
feedback.Outputs Effect: Excluded — Does not emit force, signal, or change.
feedback.Processes Signals/Logic: Excluded — No signal-processing or computational behavior.
feedback.State-Transforming: Excluded — Remains static in form unless externally altered.
feedback.Human-Interactive: Included — Designed for human handling, opening, and usage.
feedback.System-integrated: Excluded — May be used in systems but is not intrinsically embedded.
feedback.Functionally Autonomous: Excluded — Requires external use; no built-in autonomy.
feedback.System-Essential: Excluded — Not critical to any one system by default.
feedback.Signalling: Excluded — Does not communicate or encode information.
feedback.Rule-governed: Excluded — No logical or formal structure governs its behavior.
feedback.Compositional: Excluded — Not a modular or layered abstraction.
feedback.Meta: Excluded — Not self-referential or conceptually structured.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — Not intrinsically defined by time.
feedback.Social Construct: Excluded — Exists materially regardless of interpretation.
feedback.Institutionally Defined: Excluded — Not defined by regulation in its form.
feedback.Identity-Linked: Excluded — Not associated with role or group identity.
feedback.Regulated: Excluded — May be subject to recycling policies, but not inherently regulated.
feedback.Economically Significant: Excluded — Common object with low standalone economic value.
feedback.Politicised: Excluded — Not directly involved in political discourse.
feedback.Ritualised: Excluded — Not formally used in symbolic practice.
feedback.Ethically Significant: Included — Tied to energy consumption and environmental ethics through its manufacture and disposal lifecycle.

encoding_notes: This encoding treats the glass bottle as a passive, manufactured container. Its physical and functional traits are clear, and its ethical relevance arises directly from its material lifecycle impact. All contextual uses or symbolic meanings are excluded.
